00025 #include "LPC17xx.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_gpio.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"

00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00037 #define MCB_LPC_1768
00038 //#define IAR_LPC_1768
00039 
00040 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00041 /* LED pin in byte style on P1 */
00042 #define POLL_LED        (1<<4)          // P1.28
00043 #define INT3_LED        (1<<5)          // P1.29
00044 #define GPIO_INT        (1<<25)         // test GPIO interrupt on P0.25
00045 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00046 #define POLL_LED        (1<<1)          //P1.25 (LED2)
00047 #define INT3_LED        (1<<4)          //P0.4  (LED1)
00048 #define GPIO_INT        (1<<23)         // test GPIO interrupt on P0.23
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 
00052 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00053 void EINT3_IRQHandler(void);
00054 
00055 void delay (void);
00056 
00057 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00058 /*********************************************************************/
00063 void EINT3_IRQHandler(void)
00064 {
00065               int j;
00066               if(GPIO_GetIntStatus(0, 25, 1))
00067                   {
00068                   GPIO_ClearInt(0,(1<<25));
00069                           for (j= 0; j<8; j++)
00070                           {
00071 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00072                                   /* Use MCB1700 board:
00073                                    * blink LED P1.29 when EINT3 occur
00074                                    */
00075                                     FIO_ByteSetValue(1, 3, INT3_LED);
00076                                         delay();
00077                                         FIO_ByteClearValue(1, 3, INT3_LED);
00078                                     delay();
00079 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00080                                 /* Use IAR LPC1768 KS board:
00081                                  * blink LED2 P0.4 when EINT3 occur
00082                                  */
00083                                     FIO_ByteSetValue(0, 0, INT3_LED);
00084                                         delay();
00085                                         FIO_ByteClearValue(0, 0, INT3_LED);
00086                                     delay();
00087 #endif
00088                           }
00089           }
00090 }
00091

00098 void delay (void) {
00099   unsigned int i;
00100 
00101   for (i = 0; i < 0x100000; i++) {
00102   }
00103 }

00106 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00107 /*********************************************************************/
00112 int c_entry (void)
00113 {
00118 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00119         FIO_ByteSetDir(1, 3, POLL_LED, 1);
00120         FIO_ByteSetDir(1, 3, INT3_LED, 1);
00121         // Turn off all LEDs
00122         FIO_ByteClearValue(1, 3, POLL_LED);
00123         FIO_ByteClearValue(1, 3, INT3_LED);
00124 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00125         FIO_ByteSetDir(1, 3, POLL_LED, 1);
00126         FIO_ByteSetDir(0, 0, INT3_LED, 1);
00127         // Turn off all LEDs
00128         FIO_ByteSetValue(1, 3, POLL_LED);
00129         FIO_ByteSetValue(0, 0, INT3_LED);
00130 #endif
00131 
00132         // Enable GPIO interrupt
00133         /* Use MCB1700: test GPIO interrupt on P0.25->connects with ADC potentiometer
00134          * Use IAR KS : test GPIO interrupt on P0.23->connects with BUT1 button
00135          */
00136         GPIO_IntCmd(0,(1<<25),1);
00137         NVIC_EnableIRQ(EINT3_IRQn);
00138 
00139         while (1)
00140         {
00141                 //polling led while idle
00142                 FIO_ByteSetValue(1, 3, POLL_LED);
00143                 delay();
00144                 FIO_ByteClearValue(1, 3, POLL_LED);
00145                 delay();
00146         }
00147 }
00148 
00149 
00150 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00151    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00152    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00153    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00154    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00155 int main(void)
00156 {
00157     return c_entry();
00158 }

00163 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.

00165 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00166 * @return               None

00169 {
00170         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00171          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00172

00174         while(1);
00175 }
